info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 04 at 9:25PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Mecklenburg County through 1000 PM EDT... At 925 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Boydton to near Brodnax. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... South Hill, Brodnax and La Crosse around 930 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Beechwood, John H Kerr Dam, Finchley, Skipwith, Forksville, Rogers Corner, Richardson, Bracey, Keats and Eppes Fork. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
